intro: Iphiona scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with succulent, ribbed stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually rough and covered in fine hairs, giving it a textured appearance. Iphiona scabra is adapted to thrive in harsh environments, often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas.
